meanings.sent1: The pernicious storm destroyed the entire village.
meanings.sent2: The pernicious chemicals in the water polluted the river.
meanings.sent3: The pernicious squirrel kept stealing all the nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: His pernicious lies spread like wildfire through the small town.
meanings.sent5: The pernicious virus quickly spread throughout the school, infecting many students.

meanings.definition: Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way.
meanings.sent1: The pernicious habit of procrastination slowly affected his grades.
meanings.sent2: The pernicious rumors spread quietly through the office.
meanings.sent3: The pernicious alarm clock refused to wake him up in the morning.
meanings.sent4: Her pernicious jealousy ate away at their friendship over time.
meanings.sent5: The pernicious weeds in the garden slowly choked out the flowers.
